</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;MARGIN-LEFT:10%;">
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(1)
</FONT>
</DT>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Annual
	revenue calculations are based on an assumed 364 revenue days per annum representing contracted revenues, based on contracted charter rates from our
	current charter agreements. Although these revenues are based on contractual charter rates, any contract is subject to performance by the counter parties and us. Additionally, the revenues above
	reflect an estimate of off-hire days to perform periodic maintenance. If actual off-hire days are greater than estimated, these would decrease the level of revenues above.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(2)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Includes
	the
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	CMA CGM Moliere
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	delivered to us in 2009 and the
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	CMA CGM
	Musset
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	, the
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	CMA CGM Nerval
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	, the
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	CMA CGM Rabelais
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	and the
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	CMA CGM Racine
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	, delivered
	to us in 2010, which are each subject to options for the charterer to purchase the vessels eight years after the commencement
	of the respective charters, which fall in September 2017, March 2018, May 2018, July 2018 and August 2018, respectively, each for $78.0&nbsp;million. The $78.0&nbsp;million option prices
	reflected, at the time we entered into the applicable charter, an estimate of the fair market value of the vessels at the time we would be required to sell the vessels upon exercise of the options.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(3)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	An
	aggregate of $242.5&nbsp;million ($48.5&nbsp;million with respect to each vessel) of revenue with respect to the
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	CMA CGM
	Moliere
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	, the
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	CMA CGM Musset
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	, the
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	CMA CGM Nerval
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	, the
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	CMA
	CGM Rabelais
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	and the
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	CMA CGM Racine
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	, following September 2017, March 2018, May 2018, July 2018 and August 2018, respectively, is
	included in the table because we cannot predict the likelihood of these options being exercised.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
	generally do not charter our containerships in the spot market. Vessels operating in the spot market generate revenues that are less predictable than vessels on period charters,
	although this chartering strategy can enable vessel owners to capture increased profit margins during periods of improvements in charter rates. Deployment of vessels in the spot market creates
	exposure, however, to the risk of declining charter rates, as spot rates may be higher or lower than those rates at which a vessel could have been time chartered for a longer period.
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Voyage Expenses
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Voyage expenses include port and canal charges, bunker (fuel) expenses (bunker costs are normally covered by our charterers, except in
	certain cases such as vessel re-positioning), address commissions and brokerage commissions. Under multi-year time charters and bareboat charters, such as those on which we charter our containerships
	and under short-term time charters, the charterers bear the voyage expenses other than brokerage and address commissions and fees. As such, voyage expenses represent a relatively small portion of our
	vessels' overall expenses.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	56
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=5,SEQ=58,EFW="2227685",CP="DANAOS CORPORATION",DN="1",CHK=795780,FOLIO='56',FILE='DISK124:[15ZDA1.15ZDA73501]DK73501A.;12',USER='DSLOAN',CD='15-MAR-2016;12:35' -->
<A NAME="A2227685Z20-F_HTM_PAGE_DK73501_1_57">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227685Z20-F_HTM_BG73501A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;From
	time to time, in accordance with industry practice and in respect of the charters for our containerships we pay brokerage commissions of approximately 0.75% to 2.5% of the total
	daily charter hire rate under the charters to unaffiliated ship brokers associated with the charterers, depending on the number of brokers involved with arranging the charter. We also pay address
	commissions of 1.25% up to 3.5% to a limited number of our charterers. Our manager will also receive a fee of 0.5% based on the contract price of any vessel bought or sold by it on our behalf,
	excluding newbuilding contracts. In 2015 and 2014 we paid a fee to our manager of 1.25% on all freight, charter hire, ballast bonus and demurrage for each vessel. In 2013, this fee was 1.00%. In 2016,
	this fee will remain at 1.25%.
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Vessel Operating Expenses
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Vessel operating expenses include crew wages and related costs, the cost of insurance, expenses for repairs and maintenance, the cost
	of spares and consumable stores, tonnage taxes and other miscellaneous expenses. Aggregate expenses increase as the size of our fleet increases. Factors beyond our control, some of which may affect
	the shipping industry in general, including, for instance, developments relating to market premiums for insurance, may also cause these expenses to increase. In addition, a substantial portion of our
	vessel operating expenses, primarily crew wages, are in currencies other than the U.S. dollar and any gain or loss we incur as a result of the U.S. dollar fluctuating in value against these currencies
	is included in vessel operating expenses. We fund our manager monthly in advance with amounts it will need to pay our fleet's vessel operating expenses.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Under
	time charters, such as those on which we charter all but two of the containerships in our fleet as of February&nbsp;29, 2016, we pay for vessel operating expenses. Under bareboat
	charters, such as those on which we chartered the remaining two containerships in our fleet, our charterers bear substantially all vessel operating expenses, including the costs of crewing, insurance,
	surveys, drydockings, maintenance and repairs.
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Amortization of Deferred Drydocking and Special Survey Costs
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We follow the deferral method of accounting for special survey and drydocking costs, whereby actual costs incurred are deferred and are
	amortized on a straight-line basis over the period until the next scheduled survey and drydocking, which is two and a half years. If special survey or drydocking is performed prior to the scheduled
	date, the remaining unamortized balances are immediately written off. The amortization periods reflect the estimated useful economic life of the deferred charge, which is the period between each
	special survey and drydocking.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Major
	overhaul performed during drydocking is differentiated from normal operating repairs and maintenance. The related costs for inspections that are required for the vessel's
	certification under the requirement of the classification society are categorized as drydock costs. A vessel at drydock performs certain assessments, inspections, refurbishments, replacements and
	alterations within a safe non-operational environment that allows for complete shutdown of certain machinery and equipment, navigational, ballast (keep the vessel upright) and safety systems, access
	to major underwater components of vessel (rudder, propeller, thrusters and anti-corrosion systems), which are not accessible during vessel operations, as well as hull treatment and paints. In
	addition, specialized equipment is required to access and maneuver vessel components, which are not available at regular ports.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Repairs
	and maintenance normally performed during operation either at port or at sea have the purpose of minimizing wear and tear to the vessel caused by a particular incident or normal
	wear and tear. Repair and maintenance costs are expensed as incurred.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	57
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=6,SEQ=59,EFW="2227685",CP="DANAOS CORPORATION",DN="1",CHK=911961,FOLIO='57',FILE='DISK124:[15ZDA1.15ZDA73501]DK73501A.;12',USER='DSLOAN',CD='15-MAR-2016;12:35' -->
<A NAME="A2227685Z20-F_HTM_PAGE_DK73501_1_58">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227685Z20-F_HTM_BG73501A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Depreciation
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We depreciate our containerships on a straight-line basis over their estimated remaining useful economic lives. We estimated the useful
	lives of our containerships to be 30&nbsp;years from the year built. Depreciation is based on cost, less the estimated scrap value of $300 per ton for all vessels.
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	General and Administrative Expenses
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We paid our manager the following fees for 2015: (i)&nbsp;a fee of $850 per day, (ii)&nbsp;a fee of $425 per vessel per day for
	vessels on bareboat charter, pro rated for the number of calendar days we own each vessel, (iii)&nbsp;a fee of $850 per vessel per day for vessels other than those on bareboat charter, pro rated for
	the number of calendar days we own each vessel, (iv)&nbsp;a flat fee of $725,000 per newbuilding vessel, if any, which we capitalize, for the on premises supervision of newbuilding contracts by
	selected engineers and others of its staff and a fee of &euro;0.51&nbsp;million ($0.56&nbsp;million) for the services of our executive officers for the period from January&nbsp;1,
	2015 to April&nbsp;30, 2015, after which date we have directly employed our executive officers. Our executive officers received an aggregate of &euro;1.02&nbsp;million
	($1.14&nbsp;million) in compensation for the period from May&nbsp;1, 2015 to December&nbsp;31, 2015. For the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014, we paid our manager: (i)&nbsp;a fee of $800
	per day, (ii)&nbsp;a fee of $400 per vessel per day for vessels on bareboat charter, pro rated for the number of calendar days we own each vessel, (iii)&nbsp;a fee of $800 per vessel per day for
	vessels other than those on bareboat charter, pro rated for the number of calendar days we own each vessel, (iv)&nbsp;a flat fee of $725,000 per newbuilding vessel, if any, which we capitalize, for
	the on premises supervision of newbuilding contracts by selected engineers and others of its staff and an annual fee of &euro;1.47&nbsp;million ($1.92&nbsp;million) for the services of
	our executive officers. For the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013, we paid to our manager: (i)&nbsp;a fee of $675 per day, (ii)&nbsp;a fee of $340 per vessel per day for vessels on bareboat
	charter, pro rated for the number of calendar days we own each vessel, (iii)&nbsp;a fee of $675 per vessel per day for vessels other than those on bareboat charter, pro rated for the number of
	calendar days we own each vessel, (iv)&nbsp;a flat fee of
	$725,000 per newbuilding vessel, if any, which we capitalize, for the on premises supervision of newbuilding contracts by selected engineers and others of its staff and an annual fee of
	&euro;1.4&nbsp;million ($1.86&nbsp;million) for the services of our executive officers.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;For
	2016, we will pay $850 per day, a fee of $425 per vessel per day for vessels on bareboat charter and $850 per vessel per day for vessels on time charter.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Furthermore,
	general and administrative expenses include audit fees, legal fees, board remuneration, executive officers compensation, directors&nbsp;&amp; officers insurance, stock
	exchange fees and other general and administrative expenses.
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Other Income/(Expenses), Net
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In 2015, we recorded income of $0.1&nbsp;million for various non-operating items. In 2014 and 2013, we recorded income of
	$0.4&nbsp;million and $0.3&nbsp;million respectively for various non-operating items.
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Interest Expense, Interest Income and Other finance expenses
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We incur interest expense on outstanding indebtedness under our credit facilities which we include in interest expense. We also
	incurred financing costs in connection with establishing those facilities, which is included in our finance expenses. Further, we earn interest on cash deposits in interest bearing accounts and on
	interest bearing securities, which we include in interest income. We will incur additional interest expense in the future on our outstanding borrowings and under future borrowings.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	58
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>

<!-- ZEQ.=7,SEQ=60,EFW="2227685",CP="DANAOS CORPORATION",DN="1",CHK=893144,FOLIO='58',FILE='DISK124:[15ZDA1.15ZDA73501]DK73501A.;12',USER='DSLOAN',CD='15-MAR-2016;12:35' -->
<A NAME="A2227685Z20-F_HTM_PAGE_DK73501_1_59">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227685Z20-F_HTM_BG73501A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Unrealized and Realized Loss on Derivatives
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The interest rate swap arrangements we entered into were generally based on the forecasted delivery of vessels we contracted for and
	our debt financing needs associated therewith. All changes in the fair value of our cash flow interest rate swap agreements are recorded in earnings under "Unrealized and Realized Losses on
	Derivatives". Recognition of non-cash fair value movements of our interest rate swaps directly in our earnings creates potential volatility in our reported earnings. We recorded in our earnings gross
	unrealized gains from changes in the fair value of the cash flow interest rate swaps of $48.9&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
	evaluated whether it is probable that the previously hedged forecasted interest payments prior to June&nbsp;30, 2012 are probable to not occur in the originally specified time
	period. We have concluded that the previously hedged forecasted interest payments are probable of occurring. Therefore, unrealized gains or losses in accumulated other comprehensive loss associated
	with the previously designated cash flow interest rate swaps will remain frozen in accumulated other comprehensive loss and recognized in earnings when the interest payments will be recognized. If
	such interest payments were to be identified as being probable of not occurring, the accumulated other comprehensive loss balance pertaining to these amounts would be reversed through earnings
	immediately. We reclassified from Accumulated Other Comprehensive Loss to our earnings unrealized losses of $32.6&nbsp;million, resulting in net unrealized gains of $16.2&nbsp;million for the year
	ended December&nbsp;31, 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As
	of December&nbsp;31, 2015, the total notional amount of our cash flow interest rate swap arrangements was $775&nbsp;million and are all scheduled to terminate in 2016.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Results of Operations
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>

<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 compared to the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;During the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, we had an average of 56.0 containerships compared to 55.9 containerships for the year
	ended December&nbsp;31, 2014. Our fleet
	utilization increased to 99.0% in the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 compared to 97.5% in the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014. We did not sell or acquire any vessels in 2015. During the year
	ended December&nbsp;31, 2014, we sold five of our older vessels, the

</FONT>

<FONT SIZE=2>
	.

<FONT SIZE=2>
	and
	the
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Mytilini,
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	which were generating revenues in the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 and were sold within 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	$0.5&nbsp;million of additional revenues due to improved fleet utilization in the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 compared to
	the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</UL>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Voyage Expenses
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Voyage expenses decreased by $0.7&nbsp;million, to $12.3&nbsp;million in the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, from
	$13.0&nbsp;million in the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Vessel Operating Expenses
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Vessel operating expenses decreased by 1.0%, or $1.1&nbsp;million, to $112.7&nbsp;million in the year ended December&nbsp;31,
	2015, from $113.8&nbsp;million in the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014. The reduction is attributable to a 2% improvement in the average daily operating cost per vessel between the two periods,
	which decreased to $5,720 per day for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, from $5,838 per day for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014. We believe that our daily operating cost ranks as one of
	the most competitive in the industry.
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Depreciation
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Depreciation expense decreased by 3.9%, or $5.3&nbsp;million, to $131.8&nbsp;million in the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015
	from $137.1&nbsp;million in the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014, mainly due to the lower depreciation expense on the eight 2,200 TEU vessels with respect to which we recorded an impairment
	charge on December&nbsp;31, 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Amortization of Deferred Drydocking and Special Survey Costs
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Amortization of deferred dry-docking and special survey costs decreased by $0.6&nbsp;million, to $3.8&nbsp;million in the year
	ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, from $4.4&nbsp;million in the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014. The decrease is mainly due to the expiration of the amortization periods related to certain vessels
	during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 compared to the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	General and Administrative Expenses
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;General and administrative expenses increased by $0.4&nbsp;million, to $21.8&nbsp;million in the year ended December&nbsp;31,
	2015, from $21.4&nbsp;million the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014. Effective January&nbsp;1, 2015, our management fees were adjusted to a fee of $850 per day, a fee of $425 per vessel per day
	for vessels on bareboat charter and a fee of $850 per vessel per day for vessels on time charter.
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Gain on Sale of Vessels
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;There were no vessel sales in the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015. Gain on sale of vessels amounted to $5.7&nbsp;million in the
	year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 as a result of sale of the
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Marathonas
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	, the
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Commodore
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	, the
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Mytilini
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	, the
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Duka
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	and the
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Messologi
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(on
	February&nbsp;26, 2014, April&nbsp;25, 2014, May&nbsp;15, 2014, May&nbsp;15, 2014 and May&nbsp;20, 2014, respectively).
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Impairment Loss
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As of December&nbsp;31, 2015, we recognized an impairment loss of $39.0&nbsp;million in relation to twelve of our older vessels
	held and used and $2.1&nbsp;million in relation to the
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Federal,
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	which was held for sale as of December&nbsp;31, 2015. As of December&nbsp;31,
	2014, we recognized an impairment loss of $75.8&nbsp;million in relation to eight 2,200 TEU vessels. See "Critical Accounting Policies&#151;Impairment of Long-lived Assets."
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	60
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=9,SEQ=62,EFW="2227685",CP="DANAOS CORPORATION",DN="1",CHK=170156,FOLIO='60',FILE='DISK124:[15ZDA1.15ZDA73501]DK73501A.;12',USER='DSLOAN',CD='15-MAR-2016;12:35' -->
<A NAME="A2227685Z20-F_HTM_PAGE_DK73501_1_61">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227685Z20-F_HTM_BG73501A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Interest Expense, Interest Income, and Other Finance Expenses
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Interest expense decreased by 12.0%, or $9.6&nbsp;million, to $70.4&nbsp;million in the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, from
	$80.0&nbsp;million in the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014. The change in interest expense was mainly due to the decrease in our average debt by $221.8&nbsp;million, to $2,894.7&nbsp;million
	in the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, from $3,116.5&nbsp;million in the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014, as well as the decrease in the cost of debt servicing in the year ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2015 compared to the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014, mainly driven by the accelerated amortization of our fixed rate debt, which bears a higher cost compared to our floating
	rate debt.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As
	of December&nbsp;31, 2015, the debt outstanding was $2,775.4&nbsp;million compared to $3,015.5&nbsp;million as of December&nbsp;31, 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Interest
	income amounted to $3.4&nbsp;million in the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 compared to $1.7&nbsp;million in the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014. This increase is
	attributed to the interest income related to the ZIM securities we received in the ZIM restructuring that became effective on July&nbsp;16, 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Other
	finance costs, net, decreased by $1.1&nbsp;million, to $18.7&nbsp;million in the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, from $19.8&nbsp;million in the year ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2014. This decrease was mainly due to the
	$1.0&nbsp;million decrease in amortization of finance fees (which have been deferred and are being amortized over the term of the respective credit facilities) in the year ended December&nbsp;31,
	2015 compared to the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Equity loss on investments
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Equity loss on investments of $1.9&nbsp;million in the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 relates to the investment in Gemini where
	the Company has a 49% shareholding interest. This loss reflects operating losses of two out of the four vessels that have been acquired by Gemini that have not yet entered into long-term charter
	arrangements. We did not have any equity investments accounted for under the equity method of accounting in the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Unrealized and Realized Loss on Derivatives
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Unrealized gain on interest rate swaps amounted to $16.2&nbsp;million in the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 compared to a gain
	of $24.9&nbsp;million in the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014. The unrealized gains were attributable to mark to market valuation of our swaps, as well as reclassification of unrealized losses
	from Accumulated Other Comprehensive Loss to our earnings due to the discontinuation of hedge accounting since July&nbsp;1, 2012.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Realized
	loss on interest rate swaps decreased by $67.4&nbsp;million, to $56.2&nbsp;million in the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, from $123.6&nbsp;million in the year ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2014. This decrease is attributable to a $1,402.9&nbsp;million lower average notional amount of swaps during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 compared to the year ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2014 as a result of swap expirations.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	61
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>

<FONT>
</FONT>
</TD>

</DIV>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 compared to the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;During the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014, we had an average of 55.9 containerships compared to 61.0 containerships for the year
	ended December&nbsp;31, 2013. Our fleet utilization increased to 97.5% in the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 compared to 93.4% in the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013. During the year ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2014, we sold five of our older vessels, the
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Marathonas
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	, the
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Commodore
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	, the
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Mytilini
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	, the
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Duka
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	and the
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Messologi,
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	and we acquired
	two 6,402 TEU secondhand containerships built in 2002, the
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Performance
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	and the
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Priority
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	. During the year
	ended December&nbsp;31, 2014, our fleet utilization for the fleet under employment was 98.5% (which excludes the laid up vessels).
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Operating Revenues
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Operating revenues decreased by 6.1%, or $36.0&nbsp;million, to $552.1&nbsp;million in the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014,
	from $588.1&nbsp;million in the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Operating
	revenues for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 reflect:
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	$9.1&nbsp;million of additional revenues in the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 compared to the year ended December&nbsp;31,
	2013, $0.9&nbsp;million of which related to the
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>

</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	and
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>

</FONT>

</FONT>
</DT>

	2013, related to the agreement we entered into with ZIM for a reduction in the charter rates payable by ZIM under the time charters for six of our vessels.
</FONT>

	2013, related to the

</I>

<!-- ZEQ.=11,SEQ=64,EFW="2227685",CP="DANAOS CORPORATION",DN="1",CHK=950372,FOLIO='62',FILE='DISK124:[15ZDA1.15ZDA73501]DK73501A.;12',USER='DSLOAN',CD='15-MAR-2016;12:35' -->
<A NAME="A2227685Z20-F_HTM_PAGE_DK73501_1_63">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227685Z20-F_HTM_BG73501A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	$12.3&nbsp;million decrease in revenues in the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 compared to the year ended December&nbsp;31,
	2013, which was mainly attributable to the re-chartering of certain vessels at lower rates than what they had previously been earning as a result of the soft charter market.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</UL>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Voyage Expenses
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Voyage expenses increased by $1.2&nbsp;million, to $13.0&nbsp;million in the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014, from
	$11.8&nbsp;million in the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013, mainly attributed to the increase of the fee on gross freight, charter hire, ballast bonus and demurrage payable to our manager with
	respect to each vessel in the fleet from 1.00% to 1.25% effective January&nbsp;1, 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Vessel Operating Expenses
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Vessel operating expenses decreased by 6.8%, or $8.3&nbsp;million, to $113.8&nbsp;million in the year ended December&nbsp;31,
	2014, from $122.1&nbsp;million in the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013. The reduction is mainly attributable to the decrease in the average number of vessels in our fleet during the year ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2014 compared to the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	average daily operating cost per vessel decreased to $5,838 per day for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014, from $5,987 per day for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013
	mainly as a result of the sale of the older vessels in our fleet whose contribution in daily operating expenses was higher than the fleet average. We believe our daily operating cost ranks as one of
	the most competitive in the industry.
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Depreciation
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Depreciation expense decreased by 0.2%, or $0.3&nbsp;million, to $137.1&nbsp;million in the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014,
	from $137.4&nbsp;million in the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013. The decrease in depreciation expense was due to the lower average number of vessels in our fleet during the year ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2014 compared to the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013.
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Amortization of Deferred Drydocking and Special Survey Costs
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Amortization of deferred dry-docking and special survey costs decreased by 20.0%, or $1.1&nbsp;million, to $4.4&nbsp;million in the
	year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014, from $5.5&nbsp;million in the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013. The decrease reflects reduced dry-docking costs amortized during the year ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2014 compared to the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013.
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	General and Administrative Expenses
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;General and administrative expenses increased by 9.7%, or $1.9&nbsp;million, to $21.4&nbsp;million in the year ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2014, from $19.5&nbsp;million in the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013. The increase was mainly due to increased fees of $1.3&nbsp;million paid to our Manager in the year
	ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 compared to the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013, due to an increase in the per day fee payable to our Manager since January&nbsp;1, 2014, together with an increase
	of $0.6&nbsp;million in stock compensation.
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Gain/(loss) on sale of vessels
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Gain on sale of vessels, was $5.7&nbsp;million in the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 compared to a loss of $0.4&nbsp;million
	in the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013. During the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014, we sold the
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Marathonas
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	, the
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Commodore
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	, the
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Mytilini
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	, the
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Duka
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	and the
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Messologi
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(on February&nbsp;26, 2014, April&nbsp;25, 2014, May&nbsp;15, 2014, May&nbsp;15,
	2014 and May&nbsp;20, 2014, respectively) and we
	realized a net gain on these sales of $5.7&nbsp;million in aggregate. During the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013, we sold the
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Independence
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	, the
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Henry
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	,
	the
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Pride
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	, the
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Honour
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	, the
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Elbe
</I>

<FONT SIZE=2>

</FONT>

	Kalamata

<FONT SIZE=2>
	, the
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Lotus
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	and the

<FONT SIZE=2>
	63
</FONT>

<!-- ZEQ.=12,SEQ=65,EFW="2227685",CP="DANAOS CORPORATION",DN="1",CHK=533816,FOLIO='63',FILE='DISK124:[15ZDA1.15ZDA73501]DK73501A.;12',USER='DSLOAN',CD='15-MAR-2016;12:35' -->
<A NAME="A2227685Z20-F_HTM_PAGE_DK73501_1_64">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227685Z20-F_HTM_BG73501A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Komodo
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(on February&nbsp;13, 2013, February&nbsp;28, 2013, March&nbsp;25, 2013, May&nbsp;14, 2013, June&nbsp;13, 2013, October&nbsp;3, 2013, October&nbsp;22,
	2013, October&nbsp;25, 2013 and November&nbsp;12, 2013, respectively) and we realized a net loss on these sales of $0.4&nbsp;million in aggregate.
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Impairment Loss
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As of December&nbsp;31, 2014 we recorded an impairment loss of $75.8&nbsp;million in relation to eight 2,200 TEU vessels built in
	1997 and 1998. See "Critical Accounting Policies&#151;Impairment of Long-lived Assets." In July 2014, ZIM and its creditors entered into definitive documentation effecting ZIM's restructuring
	with its creditors on substantially the same terms, as described below under "&#151;Liquidity and Capital Resources," as the agreement in principle previously announced by ZIM in January 2014.
	Based on these anticipated terms, we had written down our long-term receivables from ZIM of $44.8&nbsp;million as of December&nbsp;31, 2013 and recognized a $19.0&nbsp;million impairment charge
	with respect thereto in 2013. There was no impairment loss on vessels for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013.
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Interest Expense, Interest Income, and Other Finance Expenses
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Interest expense decreased by 12.3%, or $11.2&nbsp;million, to $80.0&nbsp;million in the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014, from
	$91.2&nbsp;million in the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013. The change in interest expense was mainly due to the decrease in our average debt by $205.4&nbsp;million, to $3,116.5&nbsp;million
	in the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014, from $3,321.9&nbsp;million in the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013, as well as the decrease in the cost of debt servicing in the year ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2014 compared to the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013, mainly driven by the accelerated amortization of our fixed rate debt, which bears a higher cost compared to our floating
	rate debt.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Interest
	income was $1.7&nbsp;million in the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 compared to $2.2&nbsp;million in the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Other
	finance costs, net, decreased by $0.3&nbsp;million, to $19.8&nbsp;million in the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014, from $20.1&nbsp;million in the year ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2013. This decrease was due to the $0.3&nbsp;million
	decrease in amortizing finance fees (which were deferred and are amortized over the term of the respective credit facilities) in the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 compared to the year ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2013.
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Unrealized and Realized Loss on Derivatives
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Unrealized gain/(loss) on interest rate swap hedges was a gain of $24.9&nbsp;million in the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014
	compared to a gain of $22.1&nbsp;million in the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013. The unrealized gains were attributable to mark to market valuation of our swaps, as well as reclassification of
	unrealized losses from Accumulated Other Comprehensive Loss to our earnings due to the discontinuation of hedge accounting since July&nbsp;1, 2012.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Realized
	loss on interest rate swap hedges, decreased by $24.7&nbsp;million, to $123.6&nbsp;million in the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014, from $148.3&nbsp;million in the year
	ended December&nbsp;31, 2013. This decrease is mainly attributable to the $558.8&nbsp;million lower average notional amount of swaps during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 compared to the
	year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;With
	all our newbuildings having been delivered no realized losses on cash flow hedges were deferred during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 and the year ended December&nbsp;31,
	2013.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	64
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>

<TR BGCOLOR="WHITE" VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<TD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-LEFT:10PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Reclassification of fair value hedged debt to earnings
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;

</EFX_RESULTS_OF_OPERATIONS>
<EFX_LIQUIDITY_CAPITAL>
<A NAME="FIS_LIQUIDITY_CAPITAL"></A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Liquidity and Capital Resources
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our principal source of funds has been equity provided by our stockholders from our initial public offering in October 2006 and common
	stock sale in August 2010, operating cash flows, vessel sales, and long-term bank borrowings. Our principal uses of funds have been capital expenditures to establish, grow and maintain our fleet,
	comply with international shipping standards, environmental laws and regulations and to fund working capital requirements.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our
	short-term liquidity needs primarily relate to the funding of our vessel operating expenses, debt interest payments and servicing the current portion of our debt obligations and cash
	flow interest rate swaps liabilities. Our long-term liquidity needs primarily relate to debt repayment and capital expenditures related to any further growth of our fleet.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
	anticipate that our primary sources of funds will be cash from operations and equity or capital markets debt financings, subject to restrictions on uses of such funds contained in our
	Bank Agreement.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As
	of December&nbsp;31, 2015, we were in compliance with the financial and collateral coverage covenants under our debt arrangements. We believe that continued future compliance with
	the terms of these agreements will allow us to satisfy our liquidity needs. We anticipate that our primary sources of funds
	described above, including future equity or debt financings in the case of any further growth of our fleet beyond our currently contracted vessels to the extent permitted under our credit facilities,
	will be sufficient to satisfy all of the short-term and long-term liquidity needs described above, up to the 2018 maturity of the credit facilities under our Bank Agreement, which we expect to
	refinance at such time. See "&#151;Credit Facilities" below.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Under
	our existing multi-year charters as of December&nbsp;31, 2015, we had contracted revenues of $524.7&nbsp;million for 2016, $491.0&nbsp;million for 2017 and, thereafter,
	approximately $2.14&nbsp;billion. Although these contracted revenues are based on contracted charter rates, we are dependent on the ability and willingness of our charterers, some of which are
	facing substantial financial pressure, to meet their obligations under these charters. See "Risk Factors."
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	65
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=67,EFW="2227685",CP="DANAOS CORPORATION",DN="1",CHK=46738,FOLIO='65',FILE='DISK124:[15ZDA1.15ZDA73501]DM73501A.;13',USER='DSLOAN',CD='15-MAR-2016;12:35' -->
<A NAME="A2227685Z20-F_HTM_PAGE_DM73501_1_66">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227685Z20-F_HTM_BG73501A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As
	of December&nbsp;31, 2015, we had cash and cash equivalents of $72.3&nbsp;million and restricted cash of $2.8&nbsp;million. As of December&nbsp;31, 2015, we had no remaining
	borrowing availability under our credit facilities. As of December&nbsp;31, 2015, we had $2,775.4&nbsp;million of outstanding indebtedness, of which $270.0&nbsp;million is payable within the
	next twelve months. Furthermore, cash flow interest rate swaps with a notional amount of $775.0&nbsp;million outstanding as of December&nbsp;31, 2015, are scheduled to terminate in 2016. See
	"Item&nbsp;11. Quantitative and Qualitative Disclosures About Market Risk."
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Under
	the Bank Agreement, from May&nbsp;15, 2013, we are required to apply a substantial portion of our cash from operations to the repayment of principal under our financing
	arrangements. We currently expect that the remaining portion of our cash from operations will be sufficient to fund all of our other obligations. The Bank Agreement also contains requirements for the
	application of proceeds from any future vessel sales or financings, as well as other transactions. See "&#151;Bank Agreement" and "&#151;Credit Facilities" below.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our
	board of directors determined in 2009 to suspend the payment of further cash dividends as a result of market conditions in the international shipping industry and in order to
	conserve cash to be applied toward the financing of our extensive new building program. In addition, under the Bank Agreement relating to our existing credit facilities and various new financing
	arrangements and the Sinosure-CEXIM credit facility, we are not permitted to pay cash dividends or repurchase shares of our capital stock unless (i)&nbsp;our consolidated net leverage is below 6:1
	for four consecutive quarters and (ii)&nbsp;the ratio of the aggregate market value of our vessels to our outstanding indebtedness exceeds 125% for four consecutive quarters and provided that an
	event of default has not occurred and we are not, and after giving effect to the payment of the dividend, in breach of any covenant.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
	will not receive any cash upon any exercise of the 15&nbsp;million warrants to purchase shares of our common stock issued to our lenders participating in our comprehensive financing
	plan contemplated by our Bank Agreement described herein, as such warrants are only exercisable on a cashless basis.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	July 2014, ZIM and its creditors entered into definitive documentation effecting ZIM's restructuring with its creditors on substantially the same terms as the agreement in principle
	previously announced by ZIM in January 2014. The terms of the restructuring include a reduction in the charter rates payable by ZIM under its time charters, expiring in 2020 or 2021, for six of our
	vessels. The terms also include our receipt of approximately $49.9&nbsp;million aggregate principal amount of unsecured, interest bearing ZIM notes maturing in 2023 (consisting of
	$8.8&nbsp;million of 3% Series&nbsp;1 Notes due 2023 amortizing subject to available cash flow in accordance with a corporate cash sweep mechanism, and $41.1&nbsp;million of 5% Series&nbsp;2
	Notes due 2023 non-amortizing (of the 5% interest rate, 3% is payable quarterly in cash and 2% is payable in kind, accrued quarterly with deferred cash payment on maturity)) and ZIM shares
	representing approximately 7.4% of the outstanding ZIM shares immediately after the restructuring, in exchange for such charter rate reductions and cancellation of ZIM's other obligations to us, which
	relate to the outstanding long term receivable as of December&nbsp;31, 2013. ZIM's charter-owner creditors designated two of the nine members of ZIM's initial Board of Directors following the
	restructuring, including one director nominated by us, Dimitris Chatzis, the father of our Chief Financial Officer.
</FONT>
</P>

<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=68,EFW="2227685",CP="DANAOS CORPORATION",DN="1",CHK=1030897,FOLIO='66',FILE='DISK124:[15ZDA1.15ZDA73501]DM73501A.;13',USER='DSLOAN',CD='15-MAR-2016;12:35' -->
<A NAME="A2227685Z20-F_HTM_PAGE_DM73501_1_67">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227685Z20-F_HTM_BG73501A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Net Cash Provided by Operating Activities
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Net cash flows provided by operating activities increased by 41.4%, or $79.5&nbsp;million, to $271.7 million in the year ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2015 compared to $192.2&nbsp;million in the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014. The increase was primarily the result of a reduction in realized losses from derivatives of
	$67.4&nbsp;million, reduced interest expenses by $9.6&nbsp;million, and lower payments for drydocking and special survey costs by $4.6&nbsp;million, in the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015
	compared to the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Net
	cash flows provided by operating activities increased by 1.7%, or $3.2&nbsp;million, to $192.2&nbsp;million in the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 compared to
	$189.0&nbsp;million in the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013. The increase was primarily the result of lower net financing expenses of $35.4&nbsp;million that offset increased payments for
	drydocking of $6.6&nbsp;million and a $25.6&nbsp;million decrease in cash from operations
	in the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 compared to the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013. Lower cash from operations is attributed to a $36&nbsp;million reduction in operating revenues,
	partially offset by $10.4 million improvement in net operating costs and working capital position between the two periods.
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Net Cash (Used in)/Provided by Investing Activities
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Net cash flows (used in)/provided by investing activities decreased by $24.7&nbsp;million, to $13.3&nbsp;million used in investing
	activities in the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 compared to $11.4&nbsp;million provided by investing activities in the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014. The difference is attributed to a
	$49.5&nbsp;million decrease in net proceeds from sale of vessels, cash used for investments in affiliates of $13.2&nbsp;million in the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 compared to no
	investments in the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014, which were partially offset by a $38.0&nbsp;million decrease in amounts used in vessel purchases and other related capital expenditures in the
	year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 compared to the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Net
	cash flows provided by investing activities increased by $5.3&nbsp;million, to $11.4&nbsp;million in the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 compared to $6.1&nbsp;million in
	the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013. The difference is attributed to vessel purchases and other related capital expenditures of $39.2&nbsp;million in 2014 mainly in relation to the acquisition
	of
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Performance
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	and
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Priority
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	, as opposed to $46.8&nbsp;million of vessel purchases and other related
	capital expenditures during 2013, mainly in relation to the acquisition of
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Dimitris C
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	,
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	MSC Zebra
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	,
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Amalia C
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	and
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Danae C
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	. In addition, during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 we received net
	proceeds from the sales of the
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Messologi
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	, the
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Marathonas
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	, the
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Mytilini
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	, the
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Commodore
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	and the
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Duka
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	of
	$50.6&nbsp;million, whereas during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013 we received net proceeds from the sales of the
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Henry
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	, the
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Pride
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	, the
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Independence
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	, the
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Honour
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	, the
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Elbe
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>

</FONT>

<I>
	Hope
</I>
</FONT>

</I>

<FONT SIZE=2>

</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Kalamata
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	and the
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Komodo
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	of $52.9&nbsp;million.
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Net Cash Used in Financing Activities
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Net cash flows used in financing activities increased by $29.9&nbsp;million, to $243.9&nbsp;million in the year ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2015 compared to $214.0&nbsp;million in the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014, as a result of a $21.7&nbsp;million increase in repayments of long-term debt, which amounted to
	$243.2&nbsp;million in the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 compared to $221.5&nbsp;million in the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014. Additionally, the decrease is due to a
	$11.9&nbsp;million movement in restricted cash, which was offset partially by a $3.7&nbsp;million decrease in deferred finance costs.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Net
	cash flows used in financing activities increased by $31.4&nbsp;million, to $214.0&nbsp;million in the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 compared to $182.6&nbsp;million in
	the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013, as a result of $50.5&nbsp;million of higher repayments of long-term debt, which amounted to $221.5&nbsp;million in the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014
	compared to $171.0&nbsp;million in the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013, partially offset by a $23.4&nbsp;million positive movement in restricted cash related to release of restricted funds
	derived from vessel sales that had been earmarked to reduced indebtedness. In addition, during 2014
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	67
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=3,SEQ=69,EFW="2227685",CP="DANAOS CORPORATION",DN="1",CHK=1005729,FOLIO='67',FILE='DISK124:[15ZDA1.15ZDA73501]DM73501A.;13',USER='DSLOAN',CD='15-MAR-2016;12:35' -->
<A NAME="A2227685Z20-F_HTM_PAGE_DM73501_1_68">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227685Z20-F_HTM_BG73501A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	we
	paid $4.4&nbsp;million in full and final settlement of the amendment fee related to the 2011 restructuring that had been deferred and was payable on December&nbsp;31, 2014, compared to
	$0.1&nbsp;million in finance expenses paid during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013.
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Non-GAAP Financial Measures
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We report our financial results in accordance with U.S. generally accepted accounting principles (GAAP). Management believes, however,
	that certain non-GAAP financial measures used in managing the business may provide users of this financial information additional meaningful comparisons between current results and results in prior
	operating periods. Management believes that these non-GAAP financial measures can provide additional meaningful reflection of underlying trends of the business because they provide a comparison of
	historical information that excludes certain items that impact the overall comparability. Management also uses these non-GAAP financial measures in making financial, operating and planning decisions
	and in evaluating our performance. See the table below for supplemental financial data and corresponding reconciliation to GAAP financial measures. Non-GAAP financial measures should be viewed in
	addition to, and not as an alternative for, our reported results prepared in accordance with GAAP.
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	EBITDA and Adjusted EBITDA
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;EBITDA represents net income before interest income and expense, taxes, depreciation, as well as amortization of deferred
	drydocking&nbsp;&amp; special survey costs, amortization of deferred realized losses of cash flow interest rate swaps, amortization of finance costs and finance costs accrued. Adjusted EBITDA represents
	net income before interest income and expense, taxes, depreciation, amortization of deferred drydocking&nbsp;&amp; special survey costs, amortization of deferred
	realized losses of cash flow interest rate swaps, amortization of finance costs and finance costs accrued, impairment loss, stock based compensation, (gain)/loss on sale of vessels, unrealized
	(gain)/loss on derivatives, realized loss on derivatives. We believe that EBITDA and Adjusted EBITDA assist investors and analysts in comparing our performance across reporting periods on a consistent
	basis by excluding items that we do not believe are indicative of our core operating performance. EBITDA and Adjusted EBITDA are also used: (i)&nbsp;by prospective and current customers as well as
	potential lenders to evaluate potential transactions; and (ii)&nbsp;to evaluate and price potential acquisition candidates. Our EBITDA and Adjusted EBITDA may not be comparable to that reported by
	other companies due to differences in methods of calculation.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;EBITDA
	and Adjusted EBITDA have limitations as analytical tools, and should not be considered in isolation or as a substitute for analysis of our results as reported under
	U.S.&nbsp;GAAP. Some of these limitations are: (i)&nbsp;EBITDA/Adjusted EBITDA does not reflect changes in, or cash requirements for, working capital needs; and (ii)&nbsp;although depreciation
	and amortization are non-cash charges, the assets being depreciated and amortized may have to be replaced in the future, and EBITDA/Adjusted EBITDA do not reflect any cash requirements for such
	capital expenditures. In evaluating Adjusted EBITDA, you should be aware that in the future we may incur expenses that are the same as or similar to some of the adjustments in this presentation. Our
	presentation of Adjusted EBITDA should not be construed as an inference that our future results will be unaffected by unusual or non-recurring items. Because of these limitations, EBITDA/Adjusted
	EBITDA should not be considered as principal indicators of our performance.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	68
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>

<TD ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:0PT;FONT-SIZE:1.5PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;BORDER-BOTTOM:SOLID #000000 1.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
</FONT>
	&#8203;
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_GRID,"BORDER-BOTTOM:SOLID #000000 1.0PT;" -->
<FONT>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:0PT;FONT-SIZE:1.5PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
</FONT>
	&#8203;
<FONT>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<!-- END OF USER-SPECIFIED TAGGED TABLE -->
</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;EBITDA
	increased by $102.7&nbsp;million, to $341.3&nbsp;million in the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, from $238.6&nbsp;million in the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014. The
	increase was mainly attributable to a $58.9 million decrease in unrealized and realized losses on derivatives, a decreased impairment loss by
	$34.7&nbsp;million, a $15.8&nbsp;million increase in operating revenues, in the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 compared to the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014. The increase was partially
	offset by a $1.9&nbsp;million loss on equity investments incurred in the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 and a $5.7&nbsp;million gain on sale of vessels incurred in the year ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2014 compared to a nil gain in the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Adjusted
	EBITDA increased by $14.3&nbsp;million, to $418.3&nbsp;million in the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, from $404.0&nbsp;million in the year ended December&nbsp;31,
	2014. The increase was attributed to a $15.8 million increase in operating revenues, an improvement of 0.4&nbsp;million in operating costs in the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 compared to the
	year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014, which was offset by a $1.9&nbsp;million loss on equity investments incurred in the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;EBITDA
	decreased by $54.0&nbsp;million, to $238.6&nbsp;million in the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014, from $292.6&nbsp;million in the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013. The
	decrease was mainly attributable to an impairment loss of $75.8&nbsp;million recorded in the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 compared to an impairment loss of $19.0&nbsp;million recorded in
	the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013, a $36.0&nbsp;million decrease in operating revenues in the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 compared to the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013 and a
	$2.0&nbsp;million increase in general and administrative expenses in the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 compared to the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013, which were partially offset by a
	$27.4&nbsp;million improvement in unrealized and realized losses on derivatives in the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 compared to the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013, a $7.1&nbsp;million
	improvement in total operating expenses in the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 compared to the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013 and a $5.7&nbsp;million gain on sale of vessels recorded in the
	year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 compared to $0.4&nbsp;million loss on sale of vessel recorded in the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	69
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=5,SEQ=71,EFW="2227685",CP="DANAOS CORPORATION",DN="1",CHK=53690,FOLIO='69',FILE='DISK124:[15ZDA1.15ZDA73501]DM73501A.;13',USER='DSLOAN',CD='15-MAR-2016;12:35' -->
<A NAME="A2227685Z20-F_HTM_PAGE_DM73501_1_70">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227685Z20-F_HTM_BG73501A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Adjusted
	EBITDA decreased $30.3&nbsp;million, to $404.0&nbsp;million in the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014, from $434.3&nbsp;million in the year ended December&nbsp;31,
	2013. The decrease was mainly attributable to a $36.0&nbsp;million decrease in operating revenues in the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 compared to the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013,
	which were partially offset by a $7.2&nbsp;million improvement in total operating expenses in the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 compared to the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Bank Agreement
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As noted above, on January&nbsp;24, 2011, we entered into an agreement, which is referred to as the Bank Agreement, that, upon its
	effectiveness on March&nbsp;4, 2011, superseded, amended and supplemented the terms of each of our then- existing credit facilities ("Pre-existing Credit Facilities") (other than our credit
	facilities with KEXIM and KEXIM-ABN Amro which are not covered thereby), and provides for, among other things, revised amortization schedules, maturities, interest rates, financial covenants, events
	of defaults, guarantee and security packages. As of December&nbsp;31, 2015, we were in compliance with the financial covenants of the Bank Agreement. For additional details, please see
	Note&nbsp;12, Long-term Debt, to our consolidated financial statements included elsewhere herein.
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Interest
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Under the terms of the Bank Agreement, borrowings under each of our pre-existing Credit Facilities, which excludes the KEXIM and
	KEXIM-ABN Amro credit facilities which were not covered by the Bank Agreement, bear interest at an annual interest rate of LIBOR plus a margin of 1.85%.
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_10"></A>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Principal Payments
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Under the terms of the Bank Agreement we are required to make quarterly principal payments in fixed amounts, in relation to our total
	debt commitments from our lenders under the Bank Agreement and the January 2011 Credit Facilities (see "&#151;January 2011 Credit Facilities" below), as specified in the table below (in
	thousands):
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;WIDTH:57%;MARGIN-LEFT:10%;">

</FONT>
</DT>

<FONT SIZE=2>
	The
	Company may elect to make the scheduled payments shown in the above table three months earlier.
</FONT>
